ground_truth: Mycroft winces as Watson enjoys himself at the gaming tables and Mycroft chats to some other men. Holmes goes upstairs to investigate where he saw a bearded man carrying a nosegay appear from behind the curtains earlier. Holmes parts the curtains and sees nosegays lying on a table. A woman stands with her back to him, and he puts coins in a shell-shaped bowl. The high cheekboned brunette turns around, and Holmes sits. Madam Sim lights a match from a candle and picks up a pack of tarot cards. Holmes stares intently at the pack and places a finger on his forehead, takes the pack from her, and flicks through them. He lays the Devil card down on the table, reaches inside his jacket, takes out the letter, and drops it on the table. Sim looks amazed and picks it up, finding inside a sketch of a man with a goatee beard, and says, "That is the price I must pay to change the course of history." She looks up from the letter as he gives her a look and gets up. She reaches for a gun, while he picks up an umbrella and plans his attack on the Corsac in his mind. He swings the brolly, and the Corsac drops down. He knocks a knife from the man's hand and, in slow motion, karate-chops the Corsac about the face, followed by a kick in the groin and bludgeoning the man with the brolly. The Corsac lunges with a knife, but Holmes dodges the attack and hooks the umbrella handle around the man's throat, throws the man over his shoulder, and whacks him in the face. Now, for real, Holmes pulls the Corsac down from the rafters with the umbrella and disarms him. Sim kills the Corsac by throwing a knife into his chest. Holmes goes over to her, and as they leave, a man and two couples come in. The Corsac comes round, leaps to his feet, takes off his heavy coat in which Sim's knife is embedded, and brandishing another blade, goes after Holmes and Sim. He runs along the edge of a balcony within the building, somersaults off it down to a lower level, and heads off Holmes and Sim. Holmes throws the Corsac, who back-flips off a wall and comes at him again. Meanwhile, on the ground floor, Watson is still playing cards, at least he's winning. Sim whacks the Corsac over the head with a bottle. Holmes twists his arm and throws him onto a sofa. They struggle, and the Corsac's blade scrapes Holmes' cheek. Holmes recoils as the Corsac goes after Sim. Holmes gives chase and tackles him to the floor, but the Corsac springs up and grabs Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Mycroft flinches as Watson revels himself at the gaming tables and Mycroft converses to some other men. Holmes ascends upstairs to examine where he observed a bearded man holding a bouquet emerge from behind the drapes earlier. Holmes separates the drapes and perceives bouquets lying on a table. A woman stands with her back to him, and he places coins in a shell-shaped bowl. The high cheekboned brunette turns around, and Holmes sits. Madam Sim ignites a match from a candle and collects up a pack of tarot cards. Holmes gazes intently at the pack and places a digit on his forehead, takes the pack from her, and flicks through them. He places the Devil card down on the table, reaches inside his coat, takes out the letter, and drops it on the table. Sim looks astonished and picks it up, discovering inside a sketch of a man with a goatee beard, and says, "That is the cost I must pay to alter the course of history." She looks up from the letter as he gives her a look and rises. She reaches for a firearm, while he picks up an umbrella and plans his assault on the Corsac in his mind. He swings the brolly, and the Corsac collapses down. He knocks a dagger from the man's hand and, in slow motion, karate-chops the Corsac about the face, followed by a kick in the groin and beating the man with the brolly. The Corsac lunges with a dagger, but Holmes avoids the assault and hooks the umbrella handle around the man's neck, throws the man over his shoulder, and smacks him in the face. Now, for real, Holmes pulls the Corsac down from the rafters with the umbrella and disarms him. Sim kills the Corsac by hurling a dagger into his chest. Holmes goes over to her, and as they leave, a man and two couples enter. The Corsac comes round, jumps to his feet, removes his heavy coat in which Sim's dagger is embedded, and brandishing another blade, pursues Holmes and Sim. He runs along the edge of a balcony within the building, somersaults off it down to a lower level, and intercepts Holmes and Sim. Holmes throws the Corsac, who back-flips off a wall and approaches him again. Meanwhile, on the ground floor, Watson is still engaging in cards, at least he's prevailing. Sim smacks the Corsac over the head with a bottle. Holmes twists his arm and hurls him onto a sofa. They struggle, and the Corsac's blade grazes Holmes' cheek. Holmes recoils as the Corsac pursues Sim. Holmes gives chase and tackles him to the floor, but the Corsac springs up and seizes Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Mycroft winces as the gaming tables are enjoyed by Watson, and some other men are chatted to by Mycroft. Holmes goes upstairs to investigate where a bearded man carrying a nosegay was seen by him appearing from behind the curtains earlier. The curtains are parted by Holmes, and nosegays are seen lying on a table. With her back to him, a woman is stood, and coins are put by him in a shell-shaped bowl. The high cheekboned brunette turns around, and Holmes is sat. A match is lit from a candle by Madam Sim, who picks up a pack of tarot cards. With intense focus, the pack is stared at by Holmes, who places a finger on his forehead, takes the pack from her, and flicks through them. The Devil card is laid down on the table by him, and a letter is taken out from inside his jacket and dropped on the table. Sim, looking amazed, picks it up, finds inside a sketch of a man with a goatee beard, and says, "That is the price I must pay to change the course of history." She looks up from the letter as a look is given to her by him, and he gets up. A gun is reached for by her while an umbrella is picked up by him, and his attack on the Corsac is planned in his mind. The brolly is swung by him, and the Corsac is dropped down. A knife is knocked from the man's hand by him, and in slow motion, the Corsac is karate-chopped about the face by him, followed by a kick in the groin, and the man is bludgeoned with the brolly by him. The Corsac lunges with a knife, but the attack is dodged by Holmes, and the umbrella handle is hooked around the man's throat by him, throwing the man over his shoulder and whacking him in the face. Now, for real, the Corsac is pulled down from the rafters with the umbrella by Holmes and is disarmed by him. The Corsac is killed by Sim, who throws a knife into his chest. Sim is gone over to by Holmes, and as they leave, a man and two couples come in. The Corsac comes round, leaps to his feet, takes off his heavy coat in which Sim's knife is embedded, and another blade is brandished by him as he goes after Holmes and Sim. The edge of a balcony within the building is run along by him, a somersault is performed off it down to a lower level, and Holmes and Sim are headed off by him. The Corsac is thrown by Holmes, who back-flips off a wall and comes at him again. Meanwhile, on the ground floor, Watson is still playing cards, winning at least. The Corsac is whacked over the head with a bottle by Sim. His arm is twisted by Holmes, and he is thrown onto a sofa. A struggle ensues, and Holmes' cheek is scraped by the Corsac's blade. Holmes recoils as Sim is pursued by the Corsac. The chase is given by Holmes, who tackles him to the floor, but the Corsac springs up and grabs Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Mycroft winces as Watson enjoys the gaming tables, while Mycroft converses with other men. Holmes investigates upstairs after seeing a bearded man with a nosegay behind the curtains. Behind the drapes, he finds nosegays on a table and a woman with her back turned, depositing coins in a shell-shaped bowl. The high-cheekboned brunette, Madam Sim, turns around, lights a match from a candle, and picks up tarot cards. Holmes stares at the pack, touches his forehead, flicks through them, and places the Devil card on the table. He pulls a letter from his jacket, drops it on the table, and Sim, astonished, examines it, revealing a sketch of a goateed man. She remarks about paying a price to change history. As Holmes stands, Sim reaches for a gun, and Holmes grabs an umbrella, planning his attack on the Corsac. He swings the umbrella, disarming the Corsac, karate-chops him in the face, kicks him in the groin, and bludgeons him. The Corsac lunges with a knife, but Holmes evades, hooks the umbrella handle around the man's throat, and throws him over his shoulder, delivering a blow with the umbrella. Holmes pulls the Corsac down from the rafters and disarms him, while Sim kills the Corsac with a knife throw. As they leave, people enter. The Corsac revives, discards his coat with Sim's knife, and pursues them with another blade. He navigates a balcony, somersaults to a lower level, intercepting Holmes and Sim. Holmes throws the Corsac, who back-flips and attacks again. Meanwhile, Watson wins cards on the ground floor. Sim strikes the Corsac with a bottle; Holmes twists his arm, tossing him onto a sofa. They struggle, the Corsac's blade grazing Holmes' cheek. Holmes recoils as the Corsac charges at Sim. Holmes tackles him again, but the Corsac recovers and grabs Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Mycroft winces as Watson enjoys the gaming tables, while Mycroft chats with other men. Holmes investigates upstairs, where he saw a bearded man with a nosegay. Behind the curtains, nosegays lie on a table. A woman stands with her back to him, and Holmes puts coins in a bowl. The brunette, Madam Sim, lights a match, picks up tarot cards, and Holmes flicks through them, laying down the Devil card. He presents a letter, revealing a sketch of a bearded man, and Sim remarks, "That is the price I must pay to change history." As Holmes gets up, Sim reaches for a gun, and Holmes plans his attack on the Corsac. He disarms the Corsac with an umbrella attack, but the Corsac revives, chasing Holmes and Sim with a knife. The Corsac somersaults from a balcony, confronting them again. Sim hits the Corsac with a bottle, and Holmes throws him onto a sofa. They struggle, and the Corsac's blade scrapes Holmes' cheek. Holmes chases and tackles him, but the Corsac grabs Sim by the hair. Meanwhile, Watson wins at cards.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Mycroft winces noticeably as he observes Watson thoroughly enjoying himself at the lively and enticing gaming tables. Meanwhile, Mycroft engages in conversation with a group of other gentlemen nearby. Holmes, determined and curious, ventures upstairs to investigate the area where he previously noticed a bearded man mysteriously emerging from behind the heavy curtains, clutching a colorful nosegay. As Holmes draws back the curtains, he sees several nosegays casually lying on a nearby table. Standing with her back toward him, a woman is present, prompting Holmes to discreetly deposit coins into a shell-shaped bowl. She is a brunette with distinctively high cheekbones, and upon turning, Holmes swiftly takes a seat. Madam Sim then lights a match using a flickering candle, retrieving a pack of tarot cards. Holmes fixes his gaze intently on the pack, pressing a thoughtful finger against his forehead, before taking the cards from her and skillfully flicking through them. With precision, he places the Devil card down on the table. Reaching inside his jacket, he retrieves a letter, which he nonchalantly drops onto the table. Sim, displaying amazement, picks it up and discovers inside a detailed sketch of a man with a goatee beard. She declares, "That is the price I must pay to alter the course of history." Her gaze shifts from the letter back to Holmes, who gives her a significant look and rises to his feet. As she reaches for a gun, Holmes strategically picks up an umbrella, formulating his attack plan against the Corsac in his mind. With a swift swing of the brolly, the Corsac is knocked down. Holmes expertly disarms the man of his knife, proceeding to deliver a series of slow-motion, precise karate chops to the Corsac's face, followed by a sharp kick to the groin, and finishing with a robust bludgeon from the umbrella. The Corsac attempts another strike with his knife, but Holmes skillfully evades the attack, skillfully hooking the umbrella handle around the man's throat, throwing him over his shoulder, and delivering another forceful hit to the face. Now, in reality, Holmes brings the Corsac down from the rafters using the umbrella, successfully disarming him. In a decisive move, Sim eliminates the Corsac by expertly launching a knife into his chest. Holmes approaches her, and as they prepare to leave, they notice a man and two couples entering. Unexpectedly, the Corsac regains consciousness, leaps to his feet, and discards his heavy coat, which has Sim's knife still embedded in it. Brandishing another blade, he charges after Holmes and Sim. He races along the edge of a balcony within the building, performing an acrobatic somersault down to a lower level, effectively intercepting Holmes and Sim. Holmes retaliates by throwing the Corsac, who adeptly back-flips off a wall and charges at him once again. Meanwhile, on the bustling ground floor, Watson is still engrossed in playing cards, and at least he's winning. Sim decisively strikes the Corsac over the head with a bottle. Holmes skillfully twists his arm, throwing him onto a nearby sofa. A fierce struggle ensues as the Corsac's blade manages to scrape Holmes' cheek. Recoiling in response, Holmes observes as the Corsac turns his attention toward Sim. Holmes relentless in his pursuit, tackles the Corsac to the ground. However, the Corsac quickly recovers, springing up and seizing Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Mycroft noticeably winces as he keenly observes Watson thoroughly engrossed and evidently enjoying himself at the lively, bustling, and enticing gaming tables. Meanwhile, Mycroft engages in a conversation with a group of other gentlemen who are standing nearby. Holmes, with a determined and curious demeanor, ventures upstairs with the intention of investigating the area where he had previously noticed a bearded man mysteriously emerging from behind the heavy curtains, clutching a colorful nosegay in his hand. As Holmes carefully draws back the curtains, he sees several nosegays casually lying on a nearby table. Standing with her back toward him, a woman is present, which prompts Holmes to discreetly deposit coins into a shell-shaped bowl. She is a brunette with distinctively high cheekbones, and upon turning around, Holmes swiftly takes a seat. Madam Sim then lights a match using a flickering candle and retrieves a pack of tarot cards. Holmes fixes his gaze intently on the pack, pressing a thoughtful finger against his forehead, before taking the cards from her and skillfully flicking through them with practiced ease. With precision, he places the Devil card down on the table before him. Reaching inside his jacket, he retrieves a letter, which he nonchalantly drops onto the table. Sim, displaying a sense of amazement, picks it up and discovers inside a detailed sketch of a man with a goatee beard. She declares with conviction, "That is the price I must pay to alter the course of history." Her gaze shifts from the letter back to Holmes, who gives her a significant look and then rises to his feet. As she reaches for a gun, Holmes strategically picks up an umbrella, formulating his attack plan against the Corsac in his mind. With a swift and calculated swing of the brolly, the Corsac is knocked down. Holmes expertly disarms the man of his knife and proceeds to deliver a series of slow-motion, precise karate chops to the Corsac's face. This is followed by a sharp kick to the groin and finishing with a robust bludgeon from the umbrella. The Corsac attempts another strike with his knife, but Holmes skillfully evades the attack, adeptly hooking the handle of the umbrella around the man's throat, throwing him over his shoulder, and delivering another forceful hit to his face. Now, back in reality, Holmes brings the Corsac down from the rafters using the umbrella, successfully disarming him. In a decisive move, Sim eliminates the Corsac by expertly launching a knife into his chest. Holmes approaches her, and as they prepare to leave, they notice a man and two couples entering the room. Unexpectedly, the Corsac regains consciousness, leaps to his feet with renewed vigor, and discards his heavy coat, which still has Sim's knife embedded in it. Brandishing yet another blade, he charges after Holmes and Sim. He races along the edge of a balcony within the building, performing an acrobatic somersault down to a lower level, effectively intercepting Holmes and Sim in their path. Holmes retaliates by throwing the Corsac, who adeptly back-flips off a wall and charges at him once again. Meanwhile, on the bustling and busy ground floor, Watson remains engrossed in playing cards, and thankfully, at least he's winning. Sim decisively strikes the Corsac over the head with a bottle. Holmes skillfully twists his arm and throws him onto a nearby sofa. A fierce struggle ensues as the Corsac's blade manages to scrape Holmes' cheek. Recoiling in response, Holmes observes as the Corsac turns his attention toward Sim. Holmes, relentless in his pursuit, tackles the Corsac to the ground with urgency. However, the Corsac quickly recovers, springing up and seizing Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Mycroft winces visibly, his expression contorting slightly as he observes Watson indulging himself enthusiastically at the gaming tables, with chips clinking and cards shuffling. Meanwhile, Mycroft engages in casual conversation with some other men, their voices blending with the ambient sounds of the busy room. Holmes, however, quietly disengages from the scene downstairs and ascends the staircase, his footsteps barely audible as he makes his way to the upper level, driven by the memory of a bearded man, whom he had earlier witnessed emerging from behind the heavy curtains while carrying a fragrant nosegay. With measured steps, he approaches the curtains, his fingers finding the fabric’s edge and gently pulling it aside to reveal a small table, upon which several nosegays are laid out precisely. A short distance away, a woman stands with her back turned to him, her silhouette outlined by the ambient light. Without hesitation, Holmes places several coins into a shell-shaped bowl that sits atop the table. As the coins settle with a clink, the woman, a high-cheekboned brunette, pivots gracefully to face him, prompting Holmes to lower himself into a seated position. Madam Sim, as she is known, deftly lights a match against the flickering candle flame, her movements deliberate and practiced, before picking up a pack of tarot cards that rests nearby. Holmes fixes his gaze on the pack with intense scrutiny, raising a finger to his forehead in a gesture of contemplation. He then reaches out, taking the pack from her hand, and, with deft fingers, flicks through the cards until he isolates the Devil card, placing it purposefully on the table before her. With a swift motion, he reaches inside his jacket, extracting a letter, which he nonchalantly drops onto the table beside the card. Sim, her expression shifting to one of amazement, retrieves the letter and examines its contents, discovering within a sketch of a man with a goatee beard. She declares with a solemn tone, "That is the price I must pay to change the course of history." Her eyes lift from the letter, meeting Holmes’s gaze as he offers her a knowing look and rises from his seat. Sim responds by reaching for a gun, her intent clear, while Holmes picks up an umbrella, already formulating a plan of attack against the Corsac in his mind. With a calculated swing, he employs the umbrella with precision, causing the Corsac to drop to the floor. Holmes then deftly disarms him, knocking a knife from his grasp. In a fluid sequence of movements, he executes a slow-motion karate chop to the Corsac's face, follows it with a debilitating kick to the groin, and finally bludgeons the man with the umbrella. The Corsac retaliates by lunging with his knife, but Holmes anticipates the move, dodging adeptly and maneuvering the umbrella handle skillfully around the man's throat. In a display of strength and agility, Holmes throws the Corsac over his shoulder, administering a decisive whack to his face. Transitioning from the imagined scenario into reality, Holmes, with a determined yank, pulls the Corsac down from the rafters using the umbrella, effectively disarming him. In a swift, unexpected motion, Sim secures the victory by hurling a knife that embeds itself into the Corsac’s chest, ending the confrontation. As Holmes and Sim prepare to make their exit, a man accompanied by two couples enters the scene, oblivious to the recent events. However, the Corsac, not yet defeated, regains consciousness, launching himself to his feet, and shedding his cumbersome coat, which reveals Sim's embedded knife. Brandishing another blade, he resumes his pursuit of Holmes and Sim. The Corsac runs with agility along the edge of a balcony within the spacious building, executing a daring somersault off it to descend to a lower level, intent on intercepting Holmes and Sim. Holmes, in response, hurls the Corsac, who rebounds with a back-flip off a nearby wall, persistently advancing towards him once more. Meanwhile, down on the bustling ground floor, Watson remains immersed in his card game, focused and seemingly enjoying a winning streak. Sim takes the opportunity to strike the Corsac over the head with a bottle, creating a momentary advantage. Seizing the opportunity, Holmes twists the Corsac’s arm, leveraging his body weight to throw him onto a nearby sofa. A struggle ensues, during which the Corsac's blade makes contact with Holmes' cheek, leaving a shallow scrape. Holmes recoils momentarily from the sting, but his attention is quickly refocused as the Corsac turns his aggression towards Sim. Driven by resolve, Holmes urgently gives chase, tackling the Corsac to the floor with force, yet the Corsac exhibits resilience, springing back to his feet and seizing Sim by the hair, prompting a continuation of their fierce confrontation.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Mycroft winces as Watson enjoys the gaming tables while he chats with other men. Meanwhile, Holmes investigates upstairs, where he previously spotted a bearded man with a nosegay emerge from behind curtains. Upon inspecting the area, Holmes finds nosegays on a table and observes a woman with her back to him. He deposits coins in a shell-shaped bowl, prompting the high-cheekboned brunette, Madam Sim, to turn around and light a candle to reveal a pack of tarot cards. Holmes studies the cards, flicks through them, and deliberately places the Devil card on the table before presenting her with a letter containing a sketch of a man with a goatee. Sim is amazed, remarking on her burdens to alter history. As she looks up, Holmes prepares for action: he picks up an umbrella while envisioning his attack on the Corsac. He effectively disarms the Corsac, executing a series of skillful maneuvers including using the umbrella to incapacitate him. Sim intervenes, ultimately killing the Corsac with a knife. As Holmes and Sim exit, they encounter other patrons, but the Corsac revives, removing his coat with Sim’s knife embedded and pursues them with another blade. He navigates the building acrobatically to intercept Holmes and Sim, prompting a dynamic confrontation. On the ground floor, Watson continues to win at cards. Sim incapacitates the Corsac with a bottle, allowing Holmes to twist his arm and throw him onto a sofa. The struggle continues as the Corsac’s blade grazes Holmes’ cheek. Holmes recoils, but when the Corsac targets Sim, Holmes intervenes, tackling him to the floor, only for the Corsac to recover and seize Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Mycroft winces as Watson, who has a penchant for roulette, enjoys himself at the gaming tables, and Mycroft chats to some other men about current political intrigues. Holmes goes upstairs in the grand Victorian building to investigate where he earlier saw a bearded man carrying a nosegay, a small bouquet often used to combat foul smells, appear from behind the heavy velvet curtains. Holmes parts the curtains and sees nosegays lying on a table typically used for séances. A woman stands with her back to him, and he discreetly puts coins in a shell-shaped bowl, a customary payment for her services. The high cheekboned brunette turns around, revealing herself to be Madam Sim, a renowned fortune-teller, and Holmes sits. Madam Sim lights a match from a candle, a practice said to enhance mystical powers, and picks up a pack of tarot cards. Holmes stares intently at the pack, known for its symbolism, places a finger on his forehead as if deep in thought, takes the pack from her, and flicks through them. He lays the Devil card down on the table, a card often associated with chaos and temptation, reaches inside his jacket for an old envelope, takes out the letter, and drops it on the table. Sim looks amazed and picks it up, finding inside a sketch of a man with a goatee beard, and says, "That is the price I must pay to change the course of history," implying a significant decision demands great sacrifice. She looks up from the letter as he gives her a look and gets up. She reaches for a gun, a small pistol often hidden in a woman's bodice, while he picks up an umbrella, an unusual but effective weapon, and plans his attack on the Corsac, a notorious adversary, in his mind. He swings the brolly, and the Corsac drops down. He knocks a knife from the man's hand, and, in slow motion, karate-chops the Corsac about the face, a technique taught in Eastern martial arts, followed by a kick in the groin and bludgeoning the man with the brolly. The Corsac lunges with a knife, but Holmes dodges the attack using the agility developed from years of training and hooks the umbrella handle around the man's throat, throws the man over his shoulder with a jujutsu move, and whacks him in the face. Now, for real, Holmes pulls the Corsac down from the rafters with the umbrella and disarms him. Sim kills the Corsac by throwing a knife, which she expertly wields, into his chest. Holmes goes over to her, and as they leave, a man known for his informant ties and two couples come in. The Corsac comes round, leaps to his feet, takes off his heavy coat, often used to conceal weapons, in which Sim's knife is embedded, and brandishing another blade, goes after Holmes and Sim. He runs along the edge of a balcony within the building, somersaults off it down to a lower level with the grace of an acrobat, and heads off Holmes and Sim. Holmes throws the Corsac, who back-flips off a wall in a display of agility and comes at him again. Meanwhile, on the ground floor, Watson is still playing cards, surrounded by stacks of chips; at least he's winning. Sim whacks the Corsac over the head with a bottle, reminiscent of barroom brawls. Holmes twists his arm using a practiced hold and throws him onto a plush Victorian sofa. They struggle, and the Corsac's blade scrapes Holmes' cheek, drawing a thin line of blood. Holmes recoils as the Corsac goes after Sim. Holmes gives chase and tackles him to the floor, but the Corsac springs up and grabs Sim by the hair, pulling her towards him.

Holmes goes upstairs to investigate where he saw a bearded man carrying a nosegay appear from behind the curtains. earlier. Holmes parts the curtains and sees nosegays lying on a table. He knocks a knife from the man's hand and in slow motion karatechops the Corsac about the face followed by a kick in the groin and bludgeoning the man with the brolly. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. The Corsac lunges with a knife but Holmes dodges the attack and hooks the umbrella handle around the man's throat throws the man over his shoulder and whacks him in the face. Now for real. Holmes pulls the Corsac down from the rafters with the umbrella and disarms him. Sim kills the Corsac by throwing a knife into his chest. Holmes goes over to her and as they leave a man and two couples come in. The Corsac comes round leaps to his feet takes off his heavy coat in which Sim's knife is embedded and brandishing. another blade goes after Holmes and Sim. He runs along the edge of a balcony within the building somersaults off it down to a lower level and heads off Holmes and Sim. Holmes throws the Corsac who backflips off a wall and comes at him again. Meanwhile on the ground floor Watson is still playing cards. at least he is winning. Sim whacks the Corsac over the head with a bottle. Holmes twists his arm and throws him onto a sofa. They struggle and the Corsac's blade scrapes Holmes' cheek. Holmes recoils as the Corsac goes after Sim. Holmes gives chase and tackles him to the floor but the Corsac springs up and grabs Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Percival winces as Rufus enjoys himself at the gaming tables and Percival chats to some other dragons. Agatha goes upstairs to investigate where she saw a bearded penguin carrying a nosegay appear from behind the curtains earlier. Agatha parts the curtains and sees nosegays lying on a table. A giraffe stands with her back to her, and she puts coins in a shell-shaped bowl. The high cheekboned brunette turns around, and Agatha sits. Sir Moth lights a match from a candle and picks up a pack of tarot cards. Agatha stares intently at the pack and places a finger on her forehead, takes the pack from him, and flicks through them. She lays the Devil card down on the table, reaches inside her jacket, takes out the letter, and drops it on the table. Moth looks amazed and picks it up, finding inside a sketch of a rabbit with a goatee beard, and says, "That is the price I must pay to change the course of history." She looks up from the letter as Agatha gives her a look and gets up. He reaches for a gun, while she picks up an umbrella and plans her attack on the Owl in her mind. She swings the brolly, and the Owl drops down. She knocks a knife from the rabbit's hand and, in slow motion, karate-chops the Owl about the face, followed by a kick in the groin and bludgeoning the rabbit with the brolly. The Owl lunges with a knife, but Agatha dodges the attack and hooks the umbrella handle around the rabbit's throat, throws the rabbit over her shoulder, and whacks him in the face. Now, for real, Agatha pulls the Owl down from the rafters with the umbrella and disarms him. Moth kills the Owl by throwing a knife into his chest. Agatha goes over to him, and as they leave, a rabbit and two hedgehogs come in. The Owl comes round, leaps to his feet, takes off his heavy coat in which Moth's knife is embedded, and brandishing another blade, goes after Agatha and Moth. He runs along the edge of a balcony within the building, somersaults off it down to a lower level, and heads off Agatha and Moth. Agatha throws the Owl, who back-flips off a wall and comes at her again. Meanwhile, on the ground floor, Rufus is still playing cards, at least he's winning. Moth whacks the Owl over the head with a bottle. Agatha twists his arm and throws him onto a sofa. They struggle, and the Owl's blade scrapes Agatha's cheek. Agatha recoils as the Owl goes after Moth. Agatha gives chase and tackles him to the floor, but the Owl springs up and grabs Moth by the hair.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Mycroft winces as Watson enjoys himself at the chocolate fountains and Mycroft chats to some other men. Holmes goes upstairs to investigate where he saw a bearded man carrying a bouquet appear from behind the tapestries earlier. Holmes parts the tapestries and sees bouquets lying on a pedestal. A woman stands with her back to him, and he puts coins in a conch-shaped vase. The high cheekboned brunette turns around, and Holmes sits. Madam Sim lights a match from a lantern and picks up a pack of playing cards. Holmes stares intently at the pack and places a finger on his forehead, takes the pack from her, and flicks through them. He lays the Joker card down on the pedestal, reaches inside his jacket, takes out the map, and drops it on the pedestal. Sim looks amazed and picks it up, finding inside a sketch of a man with a moustache, and says, "That is the price I must pay to change the course of history." She looks up from the map as he gives her a look and gets up. She reaches for a sword, while he picks up a cane and plans his attack on the Serval in his mind. He swings the cane, and the Serval drops down. He knocks a flute from the man's hand and, in slow motion, karate-chops the Serval about the face, followed by a kick in the shin and bludgeoning the man with the cane. The Serval lunges with a flute, but Holmes dodges the attack and hooks the cane handle around the man's throat, throws the man over his shoulder, and whacks him in the face. Now, for real, Holmes pulls the Serval down from the chandeliers with the cane and disarms him. Sim kills the Serval by throwing a flute into his chest. Holmes goes over to her, and as they leave, a man and two trios come in. The Serval comes round, leaps to his feet, takes off his heavy cloak in which Sim's flute is embedded, and brandishing another spear, goes after Holmes and Sim. He runs along the edge of a mezzanine within the building, somersaults off it down to a lower level, and heads off Holmes and Sim. Holmes throws the Serval, who back-flips off a column and comes at him again. Meanwhile, on the ground floor, Watson is still playing dice, at least he's winning. Sim whacks the Serval over the head with a vase. Holmes twists his arm and throws him onto a recliner. They struggle, and the Serval's spear scrapes Holmes' cheek. Holmes recoils as the Serval goes after Sim. Holmes gives chase and tackles him to the floor, but the Serval springs up and grabs Sim by the veil.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Mycroft grimaces as Watson indulges himself at the gaming tables and Mycroft listens to some other men. Holmes goes upstairs to explore where he saw a bearded man juggling a nosegay emerge from behind the curtains earlier. Holmes brushes aside the curtains and sees nosegays stacked on a table. A woman stands with her back to him, and he tosses coins into a shell-shaped bowl. The high cheekboned brunette turns around, and Holmes reclines. Madam Sim ignites a match from a candle and shuffles a pack of tarot cards. Holmes scrutinizes the pack and taps a finger on his forehead, grabs the pack from her, and flips through them. He places the Devil card down on the table, reaches inside his jacket, retrieves the letter, and slides it on the table. Sim looks surprised and picks it up, discovering inside a sketch of a man with a goatee beard, and says, "That is the sacrifice I must make to alter the course of history." She looks up from the letter as he shoots her a glance and stands up. She reaches for a gun, while he snatches up an umbrella and devises his plan against the Corsac in his mind. He thrusts the brolly, and the Corsac collapses. He swats a knife from the man's hand and, in slow motion, elbows the Corsac about the face, followed by a knee to the groin and pummeling the man with the brolly. The Corsac swipes with a knife, but Holmes sidesteps the attack and hooks the umbrella handle around the man's neck, flips the man over his back, and smacks him in the face. Now, for real, Holmes hoists the Corsac down from the rafters with the umbrella and disarms him. Sim ends the Corsac by hurling a knife into his chest. Holmes moves over to her, and as they depart, a man and two couples enter. The Corsac regains consciousness, springs to his feet, sheds his heavy coat in which Sim's knife is lodged, and wielding another blade, pursues Holmes and Sim. He dashes along the edge of a balcony within the building, vaults off it down to a lower level, and intercepts Holmes and Sim. Holmes hurls the Corsac, who cartwheels off a wall and charges at him again. Meanwhile, on the ground floor, Watson is still involved in cards, at least he's succeeding. Sim clobbers the Corsac over the head with a bottle. Holmes spins his arm and tosses him onto a sofa. They struggle, and the Corsac's blade grazes Holmes' cheek. Holmes flinches as the Corsac pursues Sim. Holmes follows and wrestles him to the floor, but the Corsac jumps up and grips Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Marmaduke grimaces as Warwick entertains himself at the paintball course and Marmaduke converses with some other women. Hudson climbs downstairs to examine where he saw a mustached woman carrying a bouquet emerge from behind the bookshelf earlier. Hudson slides the bookshelf and finds bouquets resting on a sofa. A man stands with his back to her, and she drops marbles in a shoe-shaped hat. The round-faced redhead turns around, and Hudson kneels. Miss Plum strikes a match from a lantern and lifts a deck of playing cards. Hudson gazes thoughtfully at the deck and taps a chin with his elbow, takes the deck from him, and scans through them. He places the Emperor card on the sofa, reaches inside her sweater, pulls out the map, and throws it on the sofa. Plum looks astonished and picks it up, discovering inside a portrait of a person with a handlebar mustache, and states, "That is the toll I must give to alter the path of destiny." She glances up from the map as he gives him a nod and rises. She grasps for a shield, while he grabs a rake and formulates his strategy on the Vole in his thoughts. He waves the rake, and the Vole collapses. He slaps a net from the woman's palm and, in slow motion, punch-kicks the Vole about the torso, followed by a jab in the shin and walloping the woman with the rake. The Vole dives with a net, but Hudson avoids the strike and loops the rake's handle around the woman's ankle, tosses the woman over his hip, and smacks him in the torso. Now, in actuality, Hudson tugs the Vole down from the beams with the rake and strips him. Plum eliminates the Vole by launching a net into his torso. Hudson proceeds to him, and as they depart, a woman and two groups enter. The Vole regains consciousness, springs to her knees, sheds her light jacket in which Plum's net is lodged, and brandishing another net, pursues Hudson and Plum. She sprints along the rim of a porch within the structure, flips off it down to an upper level, and intercepts Hudson and Plum. Hudson hurls the Vole, who somersaults off a fence and charges at her again. Meanwhile, on the upper floor, Warwick is still rolling dice, at least she’s losing. Plum bashes the Vole over the jaw with a goblet. Hudson twists her leg and hurls her onto a chair. They tussle, and the Vole's net grazes Hudson's knee. Hudson jolts as the Vole tracks Plum. Hudson pursues and pins her to the ceiling, but the Vole leaps up and seizes Plum by the foot.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Algernon grimaces as Jamison amuses himself at the puzzle boards, and Algernon converses with some other women. Smith heads downstairs to ponder where he noticed a short man shaking a tambourine emerge from behind the curtains previously. Smith pulls aside the curtains and notices tambourines resting on a chair. A man stands with his back to her, and he drops marbles in a wicker basket. The high-nosed redhead spins around, and Smith kneels. Lady Thorn ignites a candle from another wick and lifts a set of playing cards. Smith glances curiously at the set and places a thumb on his temple, grabs the set from her, and sifts through them. He drops the King of Hearts card on the chair, reaches inside his coat, pulls out the painting, and tosses it on the chair. Thorn looks puzzled and picks it up, discovering inside a sketch of a woman with a top hat, and declares, "That is the toll I must give to alter the fate of the world." She glances up from the painting as he offers her a glance and stands up. She reaches for a broom, while he picks up a cane and dreams his confrontation with the Coyote in his mind. He twirls the cane, and the Coyote crouches down. He pushes a fork from the woman's grip and, in slow motion, elbow-strikes the Coyote about the shoulder, followed by a kick in the knee and thumping the woman with the cane. The Coyote swings with a fork, but Smith evades the move and loops the cane handle around the woman's waist, lifts the woman over his back, and taps her in the shoulder. Now, truly, Smith tugs the Coyote up from the floorboards with the cane and unburdens her. Thorn silences the Coyote by throwing a fork into her shoulder. Smith steps over to him, and as they exit, a woman and two friends walk in. The Coyote revives, leaps to her toes, removes her woolen hat in which Thorn's fork is nestled, and with a different fork, pursues Smith and Thorn. She dashes along the edge of a stairway within the building, cartwheels off it down to a higher level, and intercepts Smith and Thorn. Smith flings the Coyote, who cartwheels off a chair and charges at him once more. Meanwhile, on the upper floor, Jamison is still assembling puzzles, at least she's succeeding. Thorn taps the Coyote over the back with a slipper. Smith turns her leg and hurls her onto a bench. They grapple, and the Coyote's fork scratches Smith's arm. Smith withdraws as the Coyote pursues Thorn. Smith follows and maneuvers her to the ground, but the Coyote bounds up and seizes Thorn by the scarf.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Mycroft grimaces as Watson indulges himself at the drawing desks and Mycroft converses with some other gentlemen. Holmes goes upstairs to explore where he observed a mustached man holding a bouquet emerge from behind the drapes earlier. Holmes pulls apart the drapes and sees bouquets scattered on a desk. A woman stands with her back to him, and he drops marbles into a conch-shaped basket. The high-cheekboned brunette turns around, and Holmes kneels. Madam Sim strikes a match from a lantern and flips through a book of playing cards. Holmes gazes intently at the book and taps a finger on his chin, snatches the book from her, and shuffles through it. He spreads the Joker card on the desk, reaches inside his vest, pulls out a map, and tosses it onto the desk. Sim looks astonished and lifts it, discovering within a caricature of a man with a handlebar mustache, and says, "That is the ticket I must present to alter the fate of destiny." She looks up from the map as he throws her a glance and rises. She reaches for a sword, while he picks up a walking stick and devises his attack on the Hare in his thoughts. He swings the stick, and the Hare tumbles down. He knocks a spear from the man's grip and, in slow motion, judo-chops the Hare across the head, followed by a jab in the stomach and battering the man with the stick. The Hare strikes with a spear, but Holmes evades the assault and loops the walking stick around the man’s neck, hurls the man over his shoulder, and smacks him in the head. Now, indeed, Holmes pulls the Hare down from the beams with the walking stick and deprives him of his weapon. Sim eliminates the Hare by hurling a spear into his torso. Holmes approaches her, and as they depart, a gentleman and two duos enter. The Hare regains consciousness, springs to his feet, discards his thick cloak in which Sim's spear is lodged, and wielding another sword, pursues Holmes and Sim. He sprints along the edge of a gallery within the edifice, vaults off it down to a lower tier, and intercepts Holmes and Sim. Holmes hurls the Hare, who spins off a pillar and charges at him once more. Meanwhile, on the main floor, Watson is still drawing cards, at least he's succeeding. Sim smacks the Hare over the head with a chalice. Holmes wrenches his arm and flings him onto a chair. They grapple, and the Hare's sword grazes Holmes' cheek. Holmes withdraws as the Hare charges at Sim. Holmes dashes after and tackles him to the ground, but the Hare springs up and seizes Sim by the shawl.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Blunderbuss grimaces as Pendleton relishes himself at the dining booths and Blunderbuss juggles to some other dogs. Magellan dances upstairs to contemplate where he spotted a masked frog juggling a spatula emerge from behind the tapestries earlier. Magellan peers behind the tapestries and sees spatulas lounging on a bicycle. A clown stands with her hat to him, and he places marbles in a toaster-shaped basket. The round-eared blonde pivots around, and Magellan tumbles. Madam Quirk ignites a torch from a lantern and scoops up a pile of postage stamps. Magellan glares earnestly at the pile and taps a wheel on his ankle, snatches the pile from her, and flits past them. He drops the Joker stamp onto the bicycle, unzips a backpack, extracts a blueprint, and flings it on the bicycle. Quirk appears astonished and grabs it, discovering within a doodle of a frog with a monocle, and states, "That is the fortune I must offer to reroute the path of destiny." She peers above the blueprint as he offers a wink and takes off. She grabs for a candlestick, while he grabs a violin and formulates his parade on the Cactus in his mind. He twirls the violin, and the Cactus flutters down. He plucks a spoon from the frog's paw and, in fast motion, polka-dances the Cactus about the toes, followed by a tickle in the elbow and stroking the frog with the violin. The Cactus swoops with a spoon, but Magellan sidesteps the parade and lassos the violin string around the frog's ankle, flings the frog under his elbow, and pokes him in the whiskers. Now, for genuine, Magellan dangles the Cactus up from the chandeliers with the violin and enchants him. Quirk enchants the Cactus by tossing a spoon into his whiskers. Magellan strolls over to her, and as they linger, a cat and two chairs stroll out. The Cactus slows down, crouches to his paws, removes his flimsy cloak in which Quirk's spoon is nestled, and wielding another spoon, gallops toward Magellan and Quirk. He gallops along the border of a gazebo within the tent, cartwheels off it up to a higher balcony, and sidles away from Magellan and Quirk. Magellan flings the Cactus, who cartwheels off a roof and lurches at him again. Meanwhile, on the third floor, Pendleton is still swinging guitars, though he's losing. Quirk smacks the Cactus in the knee with a brick. Magellan wiggles his guitar and flings him onto a hammock. They dance, and the Cactus's spoon tickles Magellan's ankle. Magellan grimaces as the Cactus gallops after Quirk. Magellan swivels around and sneezes him to the ceiling, but the Cactus leaps up and clutches Quirk by the spoon.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Mycroft watches uncomfortably as Watson enjoys gaming tables while Holmes investigates upstairs. Holmes discovers nosegays and meets Madam Sim, who, using tarot cards, reveals a sketch of a bearded man. Holmes hands her a letter, startling her. An altercation with the Corsac ensues, which Holmes plans mentally. He disarms the Corsac, but Sim kills him with a knife to the chest. As they try to leave, the Corsac revives, sheds his coat with Sim's knife, and chases them. He performs acrobatics to intercept Holmes and Sim. Meanwhile, Watson continues to win at cards. Sim strikes the Corsac with a bottle, and Holmes throws him onto a sofa. After a struggle, Holmes dodges the Corsac's blade, and as the Corsac attacks Sim, Holmes intervenes, tackling him to the floor before the Corsac grabs Sim by the hair.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order

blade scrapes Holmes' cheek Holmes twists his arm and throws him onto a sofa Sim whacks the Corsac over the head with a bottle at least he is winning Meanwhile on the ground floor Watson is still playing cards Holmes throws the Corsac who backflips off a wall and comes at him again He runs along the edge of a balcony within the building somersaults off it down to a lower level and heads off Holmes and Sim another blade goes after Holmes and Sim The Corsac comes round leaps to his feet takes off his heavy coat in which Sim's knife is embedded and brandishing Holmes goes over to her and as they leave a man and two couples come in Sim kills the Corsac by throwing a knife into his chest Holmes pulls the Corsac down from the rafters with the umbrella and disarms him Now for real The Corsac while he picks up an umbrella and plans his attack on the Corsac in his mind She looks up from the letter as he gives her a look and gets up That is the price I must pay to change the course of table earlier Holmes goes upstairs to investigate where he saw a bearded man carrying a nosegay appear from behind the curtains Mycroft winces as Watson enjoys himself at the gaming tables and Mycroft chats to some other men
